marketplaces.name: claude-at-proto-plugins
marketplaces.description: Claude Code plugins for AT Protocol and Bluesky

files.README.md:
# AT Protocol Plugins for Claude Code

A marketplace of Claude Code plugins for interacting with AT Protocol networks (Bluesky, etc.).

## Installation

Add the marketplace to Claude Code:

```bash
claude /marketplace add johnwhiteside/claude-at-proto-plugins
```

Install plugins:

```bash
claude /install at-explore@claude-at-proto-plugins
```

## Available Plugins

| Plugin | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| **at-explore** | Explore and interact with AT Protocol networks via [at-explore MCP](https://mcp.atexplore.social) |
| **atproto-docs** | Search AT Protocol documentation via [@immber's mcp-atproto-docs](https://github.com/immber/mcp-atproto-docs) |
| **lexicon-garden** | AT Protocol lexicon exploration and authenticated XRPC calls via [Lexicon Garden MCP](https://lexicon.garden) |

## Adding a New Plugin

To add a new plugin to this marketplace:

### 1. Create the plugin directory structure

```
plugins/your-plugin-name/
├── .claude-plugin/
│   └── plugin.json
├── .mcp.json
└── commands/           # optional
    └── your-command.md
```

### 2. Create `plugin.json`

```json
{
  "name": "your-plugin-name",
  "description": "A short description of what your plugin does",
  "version": "1.0.0"
}
```

### 3. Create `.mcp.json`

For an **npm package** MCP server:

```json
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "your-plugin-name": {
      "type": "stdio",
      "command": "npx",
      "args": ["-y", "your-mcp-package"]
    }
  }
}
```

For a **remote HTTP** MCP server:

```json
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "your-plugin-name": {
      "type": "http",
      "url": "https://your-server.com/mcp"
    }
  }
}
```

### 4. Add commands (optional)

Create markdown files in a `commands/` directory. Claude Code will automatically discover them.

### 5. Register in `marketplace.json`

Add your plugin to `.claude-plugin/marketplace.json`:

```json
{
  "name": "your-plugin-name",
  "source": "./plugins/your-plugin-name",
  "description": "A short description of what your plugin does",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "tags": ["relevant", "tags"]
}
```

### 6. Submit a pull request

1. Fork this repository
2. Create a feature branch
3. Add your plugin following the steps above
4. Submit a pull request

## License

MIT
